instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC: What is SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC? SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC is a voltage that is created if SMC_BC_ACOK & PP3V42_G3H are both present that powers the chipset for the onewire circuit that allows the SMC to talk to the charger on the SYS_ONEWIRE line. This is necessary for the magsafe charger to have a light on it. .
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
Hey, 

Working on 820 3662, no signs of liquid or something like that. I was the first to open it and the board it's very clean! 

This machine when i turn it off normally in osx and after that if i want to turn it on, the machine don't turn on... it's necessary to remove the battery, press for 5 sec button power and plug again ..  only this way it turn on again!! 

Otherwise everything works perfectly.. seems a bios problem. but i need yours opinion to solve this issue for the best way!  

thanks

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
Monitor <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> level.
Disconnect keyboard and see how it works using power pads <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16.
You may need to remove <CAPACITOR>C4810</CAPACITOR>, to discard leakage.
Also check <RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
Hello, 

I already tested without keyboard using power pads and removed <CAPACITOR>C4810</CAPACITOR> to discard leakage.. Same behavior.. 

Do you have more ideas for this one? I already have medusa.

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message: already did the 3 PRAM reset.. no changes!

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
I was expecting to get exact voltage for <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> signal.
Do you note a drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?

Also check all PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

Returning to this one, now i don't have green light and PPBUS = 12.28V 

Already replace 2 times SMC and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. 

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> - 0.495 - Voltage = 3.4V

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> - 0.495 - Voltage 3.4V

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.38V

<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> 3.39V

<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> - 3.39V

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL> - 3.4V

Any Advice please. 

Thanks

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
SMC doesn't work.
Check voltages for <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> (2 OF 2) at page 41.
Pay atention to pull-up resistors for <SIGNAL>SMC_TXX</SIGNAL> lines and <RESISTOR>R5002</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
Hey, after check all inputs and pull up resistors and compare with a working board i reached the conclusion that SMC have problems. 

Replace again SMC and Now its working. But the main problem remains... 

"This machine when i turn it off normally in osx and after that if i want to turn it on, the machine don't turn on... it's necessary to remove the battery, press for 5 sec button power and plug again .. only this way it turn on again!!"

Already disconnect all peripherals on board, using power pads but same behavior. 

Already replace SMC, <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>. 

Already build a new bios with medusa, force Pram no changes! 

you have more ideas ?? 

thank you

threads.title: 820 3662, Strange problem
threads.message:
Try full BIOS now.
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1YVLz4ZICLo7eSdzYhJQgIyl9QHiAeqzn[/url]
Replace entire Fsys, to keep your serial number.
However, I recommend you to test it as is first...
